Title: Built-In Mathematical SQL Functions
Description: Return the arccosine of X.  The result is in radians.

Title: Built-In Mathematical SQL Functions
Description: Return the hyperbolic arccosine of X.

Title: Built-In Mathematical SQL Functions
Description: Return the arcsine of X.  The result is in radians.

Title: Built-In Mathematical SQL Functions
Description: Return the hyperbolic arcsine of X.

Title: Built-In Mathematical SQL Functions
Description: Return the arctangent of X.  The result is in radians.

Title: Built-In Mathematical SQL Functions
Description:
Return the arctangent of Y/X.  The result is in radians.  The
  result is placed into correct quadrant depending on the signs
  of X and Y.

Title: Built-In Mathematical SQL Functions
Description: Return the hyperbolic arctangent of X.

Title: Built-In Mathematical SQL Functions
Description:
Return the first representable integer value greater than or equal to X.
  For positive values of X, this routine rounds away from zero.
  For negative values of X, this routine rounds toward zero.

Title: Built-In Mathematical SQL Functions
Description:
Return the first representable integer value greater than or equal to X.
  For positive values of X, this routine rounds away from zero.
  For negative values of X, this routine rounds toward zero.

Title: Built-In Mathematical SQL Functions
Description: Return the cosine of X.  X is in radians.

Title: Built-In Mathematical SQL Functions
Description: Return the hyperbolic cosine of X.

Title: Built-In Mathematical SQL Functions
Description: Convert value X from radians into degrees.

Title: Built-In Mathematical SQL Functions
Description:
Computee(Euler's number, approximately 2.71828182845905) raised
  to the power X.

Title: Built-In Mathematical SQL Functions
Description:
Return the first representable integer value less than or equal to X.
  For positive numbers, this function rounds toward zero.
  For negative numbers, this function rounds away from zero.

Title: Built-In Mathematical SQL Functions
Description: Return the natural logarithm of X.

Title: Built-In Mathematical SQL Functions
Description:
Return the base-10 logarithm for X.  Or, for the two-argument version,
  return the base-B logarithm of X.Compatibility note:  SQLite works like PostgreSQL in that the log() function
  computes a base-10 logarithm.  Most other SQL database engines compute a
  natural logarithm for log().  In the two-argument version of log(B,X), the
  first argument is the base and the second argument is the operand.  This is
  the same as in PostgreSQL and MySQL, but is reversed from SQL Server which
  uses the second argument as the base and the first argument as the operand.

Title: Built-In Mathematical SQL Functions
Description:
Return the base-10 logarithm for X.  Or, for the two-argument version,
  return the base-B logarithm of X.Compatibility note:  SQLite works like PostgreSQL in that the log() function
  computes a base-10 logarithm.  Most other SQL database engines compute a
  natural logarithm for log().  In the two-argument version of log(B,X), the
  first argument is the base and the second argument is the operand.  This is
  the same as in PostgreSQL and MySQL, but is reversed from SQL Server which
  uses the second argument as the base and the first argument as the operand.

Title: Built-In Mathematical SQL Functions
Description:
Return the base-10 logarithm for X.  Or, for the two-argument version,
  return the base-B logarithm of X.Compatibility note:  SQLite works like PostgreSQL in that the log() function
  computes a base-10 logarithm.  Most other SQL database engines compute a
  natural logarithm for log().  In the two-argument version of log(B,X), the
  first argument is the base and the second argument is the operand.  This is
  the same as in PostgreSQL and MySQL, but is reversed from SQL Server which
  uses the second argument as the base and the first argument as the operand.

Title: Built-In Mathematical SQL Functions
Description: Return the logarithm base-2 for the number X.

Title: Built-In Mathematical SQL Functions
Description:
Return the remainder after dividing X by Y.  This is similar to the '%'
  operator, except that it works for non-integer arguments.

Title: Built-In Mathematical SQL Functions
Description: Return an approximation for π.

Title: Built-In Mathematical SQL Functions
Description: Compute X raised to the power Y.

Title: Built-In Mathematical SQL Functions
Description: Compute X raised to the power Y.

Title: Built-In Mathematical SQL Functions
Description: Convert X from degrees into radians.

Title: Built-In Mathematical SQL Functions
Description: Return the sine of X.  X is in radians.

Title: Built-In Mathematical SQL Functions
Description: Return the hyperbolic sine of X.

Title: Built-In Mathematical SQL Functions
Description: Return the square root of X.  NULL is returned if X is negative.

Title: Built-In Mathematical SQL Functions
Description: Return the tangent of X.  X is in radians.

Title: Built-In Mathematical SQL Functions
Description: Return the hyperbolic tangent of X.

Title: Built-In Mathematical SQL Functions
Description:
Return the representable integer in between X and 0 (inclusive)
  that is furthest away from zero.  Or, in other words, return the
  integer part of X, rounding toward zero.
  The trunc() function is similar toceiling(X)andfloor(X)except
  that it always rounds toward zero whereas ceiling(X) and floor(X) round
  up and down, respectively.
